greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = card{ (x,y,z) | x <= y <= z and lcm(x,y,z) = n }.
comment: A number of conjectures are possible, many of which should be easy to prove. Examples: (1) If n is a product of two primes then a(n)=13. (2) If n is a square of a prime then a(n)=6. - _John W. Layman_, Sep 01 2003
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: A086222(n) = ((A070919(n)+3*A048691(n)+2)/6); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, May 19 2017, after Jovovic's formula.
results.author: Yuval Dekel (dekelyuval(AT)hotmail.com), Aug 28 2003
ext: More terms from _John W. Layman_, Sep 01 2003
